text: TwO MEN in their early twenties, JIMMY PATTERSON and TONY BUTLER, walk down a sidewalk in the Meat Packing District Funky hole-in-the-wall bars butt up against graffiti cove steel shutters protecting closed storefronts. There are f other people on the streets at this hour: Hipsters headin out to begin their night, while the homeless hunker down. Late night delivery trucks rumble down the street. Both Jimmy and Tony are dressed down in the latest hip gr wear. There's a lot of pent-up energy crackling around th guys, especially Tony, who's twitching like roach caught a trap.
Jimmy, I'm jonesin' hard. We've gotta make a stop.
Wait on it. We're already late.
I'm telling you, I need a taste now Tony's serious.
Okay, fine. But we make it quick.
Jimmy and a SMALL GROUP OF PEOPLE, of varying ages and ethnicities mill around, smoking cigarettes. They are all waiting for an unmarked, but heavily secured door to open Tony is still twitching.
Man, what's the hold-up tonight?
Always like this on Fridays. Everyone waits till the last minute. The door opens and Tony steps out. The Waiting Man hurrie pushes past him into the building.
You ready?  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 2.
I'm set.
Let's go. As Tony and Jimmy walk away from the building, Tony reach inside his jacket. Jimmy grabs his arm.
You're not gonna do it here?
You watch me.
Not cool. He scans the street, sees an alley, shielded from the streetlights.
Over there, c'mon.
Tony hurries into the shadows with Jimmy a few steps behi They side-step the usual assortment of overflowing garbag cans. A few scavenging rats scurry away from their interrupted meals.
Dude, shouldn't be this bad. You're waiting too long between hook-ups.
Now you're the expert? I've been doing this longer than you.

What can I say? I'm a natural. Tony snorts derisively as he reaches inside his jacket to pull out something wrapped in PLAIN BROWN PAPER. He tears open the paper. Inside is not drugs, but a CLEAR, HOSPITA STYLE BAG FILLED WITH A RED, VISCOUS LIQUID. It looks suspiciously like BLOOD. Tony opens his mouth to reveal TWO SHARP, OVERLY LONG CAN TEETH. He BITES INTO THE BAG and a BLISSFUL LOOK spreads across his face as he GREEDILY GULPS down the blood. Seeing Tony's obvious, almost sexual satisfaction, Jimmy can't resist. He pulls out a similar bag of blood. But just as he's about to bite into his, Tony GAGS.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 3.
(jokes) What'd your mamma say about gulping your food? But Tony isn't laughing. He begins to CHOKE, then RETCHES UP RED FLUID.

Tony, take it easy! What's wrong with you? As Jimmy looks on in horror, Tony begins to VIOLENTLY CONVULSE. He FALLS FACE FIRST to the ground, his body FLA WILDLY. Jimmy grabs Tony, rolls him over onto his back. Tony's face is a mask of shock and fear. A SMALL CRIMSON TRICKLE OF BLOOD runs down his chin. Tony blinks rapidly as his EYES TURN RED, filling with blood. Then, with a final, PINKISH, FROTHY COUGH, it's over. Tony's hand, still clutching the plastic bag, falls to his side. His red eye now stare sightlessly at the black night sky above. Jimmy staggers back...

(completely freaked) Tony... Oh, man, oh man... He looks down at the bag of blood he's still holding in h hand. Then, looks back toward the building from where he and Tony just came. From this distance, we can now see a brightly lit sign on the side of the building. It reads: CANAL STREET BLOOD BANK. Jimmy drops his untouched bag of blood. It falls onto the ground next to Tony's lifeless body as Jimmy turns and ru first awkwardly, than faster, faster, down the alley, awa from his dead friend...

A number UNIFORMED COPS mill around, putting up crime sce tape, comparing notes. A CRIME SCENE TECH snaps a few fin photos of the dead vampire, before covering it with a tar A sea of HUMAN GAWKERS, straining their necks for a glimp of gore from behind the tape, suddenly part for ALEXANDRA CANTARA, a Classically beautiful young woman in her mid- twenties. Although in civilian dress, she carries herself with a definite air of authority. Alex quickly makes her way to the front of the gathered c Flashing her badge, she fluidly ducks beneath the gaudy y police tape and is met by DETECTIVE DARNELL HARVEY.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 4. Mid-thirties, tall, with a solid, muscular build. A caree cop you'd want at your back in a dark alley at night.
Morning, Alex.
Darnell. What've we got?

Dead Vampire. Alex follows Darnell to a tarp-covered body. They both pu on LATEX GLOVES. Alex pulls the tarp back to reveal Tony, still lying face up in what is now a pool of cold, congea blood. She scans the body.
Poor kid.
He wasn't staked. No signs of any struggle. Just lots of regurgitated blood.
Like the Vampire we found last week.
That's what I was thinking too.
Damn. (beat) You smell anything?
Just death. Alex notices the empty blood bag clutched in Tony's hand.
The Canal Street Blood Bank is right around the corner. Darnell holds up an ID card.
Yeah, this was in his wallet. Name was Tony Butler. Registered with the city for weekly withdrawals. Alex picks up the still full bag of blood laying beside T  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07
One bag per customer which means another Vampire was here. Let's get this blood tested. Darnell takes the bag and puts it in an evidence envelope
And I'll run the bag's serial number against the blood bank's records. See if I get a name. You think this other Vamp is our killer?
Vampires don't kill each other like this. And why would he take off and leave a full bag of blood behind? Especially one we can trace. Alex looks at Tony's hand clutching the empty bag.
Unless he was afraid of it...
You think something in the blood killed this guy? A dark, concerned expression washes over Alex's face.
The City's blood supply has always been safe. But if someone's found a way to tamper with it...
The Vampires will stop going to the blood banks. They'll have to find other sources for their fix.
Human sources. The Vampires will start hunting again. The Camera pans up and out of the alley, and we catch a glimpse of Alex's city, New York City...
NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 6.

A large open room, filled with about a dozen or so desks all groaning under stacks of paperwork. File cabinets lin the walls. Dry erase boards list active cases. It's a typically busy day and the bureau is filled with t usual gathering of UNIFORMED COPS, PLAIN CLOTHES DETECTIV and A MOTLEY CREW OF SUSPECTS. But as the camera pans thr the room, we see there is something very different about few of the civilians: A MAN, dressed in a business suit, answering a detective' questions, has YELLOW EYES WITH OVAL CAT-LIKE PUPILS. (A Shapeshifter ) A BEAUTIFUL WOMAN gives a tearful statement to another detective. She absentmindedly pushes back her long blonde hair to reveal AN EAR WITH A POINTED TIP (A Fairy). A STOCKY AND OVERLY HAIRY MAN in handcuffs, complains ang as he's led to a holding cell. (A Troll) The Camera finds Alex and Darnell as they enter and cross paths with DETECTIVE STERN, a career cop so horribly obno he should be in parking enforcement.
Hey, Cantara, heard another bloodsucker bit the dust.
I'll be sure to extend your sympathies to his family.
Don't get all snotty. Just cause I've got a real job and you're stuck chasing night crawlers
A crime is a crime, Stern. Everyone's equal under the law.
I remember a time when you didn't give a rat's ass about non-Human rights, Darnell.
Things change.
Guess you should know. (MORE )
NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 7.
I'm just surprised she talked you into joining the SCD. Didn't the K- 9 Unit have an open spot? Darnell moves toward Stern like he's going to clock him o but Alex quickly steps between the two men.

(to Darnell) Go pull the paperwork on the first dead vampire. As Darnell moves off, Alex gives Stern a filthy look that sends him on his way too. Alex continues on through the room, but this exchange has escaped the attention of CHIEF ALBERT KINCAID, a been the seen that, cop in his late forties. Dealing more with politicians than criminals now, his waistline has softene his fixity of purpose has not. He intercepts Alex and they continue walking together
You want me to talk to Stern?
Don't waste the oxygen. (beat) I need you to shut down the Canal Street Blood Bank. I've got a Vampire who died after ingesting blood from there.
Closing the bank is going to make people very nervous.
Well, it's making me nervous too. (lowering her voice) The Vampire today looked a lot like the one we found last week.
And you think there's something in the city's blood supply?
It's possible.
All right. I'll make the call. But this is going to bring a lot of heat down on us. (MORE )
NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 8.
Just rumors of tainted blood will start a panic. It's hard enough to get Humans and Vampires to trust each other in the best of times.
I can handle it.
Alex, I've known you since you were sixteen and I've never heard you say anything but 'I can handle it'.
And I always do.
But you don't have to do it all by yourself. Why can't you admit sometimes you need help?
From some bigoted jar-head like Stern? No thanks.
Don't worry, I don't think Stern's volunteering. In fact, no one is. You need another cop on your squad, Alex. Have you thought any more about Detective Fletcher?
The guy from Phoenix?
He's a first rate cop and willing to transfer to New York just to work with you on the SCD.
Why?
Ask him yourself.

Kincaid opens the door to his office and strides in. Alex follows to find CAMPBELL FLETCHER waiting. Campbell is a very handsome man in his late twenties with athletic build and the cocky stance of someone very sure himself and his abilities.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07
Detective Campbell Fletcher meet Detective Alexandra Cantara, head of the Supernatural Crimes Division. As Kincaid takes a seat behind his desk, Campbell extends hand to Alex.
(turning on the charm) I've heard a lot about you, Detective. He gives Alex a smile, it's a charming smile, but Alex is really not in the mood to be charmed. So, she ignores him
When I set up this squad you promised no interference.
I said minimal interference.
Hiring people behind my back is major Major interference. Campbell gives a little wave to get their attention.
Hello? I'm sitting right here.
Detective Fletcher, do you have any idea what you're signing up for?
As a matter of fact I do. Before I joined the force in Phoenix, I got my Master's degree in preternatural sociology. I've done extensive studies in non-Human criminology...
And how many non-Humans did you actually encounter out there in sunny Arizona?
Not many, but that's why I'm here.
That's what I thought.
I'm sensing a lot of hostility.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 10.
Wrong, Detective. What you're sensing is skepticism. I don't meet many cops so willing to volunteer for "Spook Squad" duty.
Obviously you volunteered.
He's got a point. Alex can't believe Kincaid has blindsided her like this. They lock eyes. Alex realizes this is a fight she won't win.
(to Campbell) Fine, but this is my game. You play by my rules.
Got it. Campbell exits. As Alex also leaves, Kincaid stops her.
You can't run this show all by yourself, Alex. I'm ordering you to give him a chance.
A chance to get himself killed? She slams the door behind her

Alex and Campbell enter to find DOCTOR RICHARD HUNTER pul on a latex glove. He stands in front of an examination ta on which Tony's naked body lays. An ARRAY of SURGICAL IMPLEMENTS, some familiar some not, rest on a nearby tray
Hey Doc.
Alex. I thought Darnell was coming down?

Why should he have all the fun? This is Detective Fletcher. He's going to be working with us on this case. Fletcher, this is Doctor Hunter, best coroner in the city.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 11. Hunter nods hello, but Campbell only has eyes for Tony's corpse. In death, Tony's mouth hangs slightly open and th tips of his fangs glint in the overhead light. Hunter reaches down and pulls Tony's lips back to reveal even more fang.
I took a dental mold to confirm his I.D. Bite imprint matches Tony Butler's registration records. Hunter closes Tony's mouth again and snaps on a second gl
Ever attended a Vampire autopsy before, Detective Fletcher?
(not worried) First time for everything. Hunter shoots Alexandra a look as he picks up a very shar SCALPEL.

Don't worry, doc. Fletcher here has a masters degree in preternatural anthropology. Hunter shrugs and brings the scalpel to Tony's chest. He presses down to make the first cut and... Suddenly, Tony's body CONVULSES and a THICK STREAM OF BLA GOO ERUPTS from the incision, bubbling up like a mini-gey before falling back onto his chest with a squishy SPLAT. Campbell turns green, in fact, a number of different gree each shade more and more impressively sickly, but he hold his ground. Dr. Hunter looks at him knowingly,
The first cut's the deepest. Just a little Coroner humor and Alex brings her hand to h mouth to keep from laughing at Campbell's reaction.
It's bad form to puke on the corpse. Campbell swallows a few times.
What is that stuff? Hunter takes a long cotton swab of the equipment tray and dips the end into the black goo.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 12.
It's the virus that turns Humans into Vampires.

(back on solid ground) Once introduced, the virus completely overwhelms the Human immune system, re-creating the host in its own image, until, viola, you're a Vampire. Hunter smears a small glass slide with the swab and moves a nearby microscope. Placing the slide on the stage, he peers through the eyepiece.
A very painful process.
And a purposeful one. A Vampire has to choose to infect the Human and there's no guarantee the Human will even survive the transformation.

The Vampire Virus in the goo resembles Human blood cells but the platelets are black with a slightly different geometry. We see a BACTERIUM smother one of the healthy Vampire blood cells, destroying it.
I found the same blood-borne infection in the Vampire you brought in last week. Some kind of bacterial toxin that suffocates healthy Vampire hemoglobin. Alex takes a look under the microscope.
It was also present in the empty bag you found, but in a dormant state. It doesn't seem to attack Human hemoglobin, just Vampire.
And our first victim was found in his apartment with a half-empty cup of blood next to him.
Could it have gotten into the blood supply by accident?  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 13.
All the blood distributed by the blood banks is cloned from genetically altered cells resistant to toxemia. This had to be introduced later.
So it was deliberate.
I'm sending samples to the National Preternatural Sciences Lab in D.C. for further testing.
Doc...
Alex, you don't have to tell me you need the results yesterday.
Alex, Kincaid, Darnell and Campbell sit around a conferen table. Case files and papers are strewn amongst styrofoam coffee cups and soda cans.
Two victims dead after drinking contaminated blood from the city's blood supply.
Victim number one, John Knox. Made a withdrawal from the East 70th Street Blood Bank the night he died. Victim number two, Tony Butler. Got his blood from the Canal Street Bank
Anything to connect them?

Just that they were Vampires. Tony was an unemployed "actor" who arrived in New York a few weeks ago. Knox was an investment strategist who lived on the Upper East Side. I talked to Knox's neighbors and co-workers. Guy didn't socialize much, rarely strayed south of the Plaza Hotel.
What about the full bag of blood we found next to Tony?  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 14.
Pulled a usable print and checked it against the registry. Darnell refers to a piece of paper in front of him.
Withdrawn by one Jimmy Patterson same time Tony was there. But it tested clean. No toxin.
He didn't stick around, try to help a fellow Vampire?
He probably just freaked. Jimmy's a minor league punk recently turned Vamp. Petty criminal with a couple of outstanding warrants.
A lot of Vampires still don't trust the police.
I got an APB out on him.
Tell 'em to keep a low profile. I want to keep a lid on this as long possible.
If there's no connection between our victims, the poisonings were random. Done by someone who wasn't too particular about their target.
We got a lot of hate groups out there. Start digging, see who could pull something like this off.
I'm on it. Darnell gathers up his files and heads out. Kincaid's CEL PHONE RINGS.
(into phone) Kincaid. (listens) Right. He hangs up and looks at Alex.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 15.
Next problem.
Alex and Campbell exit their car and find themselves in t middle of a chaotic HUMAN'S FIRST RALLY. Hundreds of peop surround City Hall. Some carry signs: "NON-HUMANS = NON-

CIVIL RIGHTS ACT NOW!!". Police barricades have establish a perimeter to keep the Human Protesters away from a voca and growing number of non-Human counter-protesters. AS slogans are chanted and slurs thrown back and forth, ange on both sides builds, threatening to boil over at any mom
Humans First is a New York-based group...
...O0f racists who believe all non- Humans should be exterminated. As Alex looks approvingly at Campbell.

You have done your homework As Alex and Campbell wade through the crowd, they're approached by CHASE DESMOND, a stunning woman in her late twenties, a sexy, professional, dresser who knows how to what she wants. A PRESS BADGE hangs around her neck.
Hey Alex.
Detective Campbell Fletcher this is Chase Desmond, a reporter for the Times. Campbell smiles warmly at this alluring woman.
You cover a lot of these protests?
Unfortunately they're news. A commotion in the crowd draws Chase's attention.
I'll catch you later. As Chase disappears into the crowd, Alex catches sight of two men making their way toward her.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 16.

Wonderful. JACK KEMP, a charismatic, Donald Trump-like businessman i his 50s approaches. He is trailed by MARK DALI, 30s, a sm corporate type with a permanent smirk on his handsome, bu cold face. KEMP. Alex, darling, how are you? It's been far too long...
Not long enough, Jack. (to Campbell) This is Jack Kemp, head of the Humans First movement and Mark Dali, his lap dog. Dali bristles.
This is a legitimate gathering, Detective Cantara. We're protected by the First Amendment.
And non-Humans are protected by the 28th Amendment.
The Non-Humans Civil Rights Act should never have been passed. And we'll do everything in our power to repeal it.

Not going to happen today, Dali. (to Kemp) What's all this about, Jack? KEMP. The Human community is very concerned about the two Vampires recently killed. Concerned the Vampires will use them as an excuse to return to their old ways.
The second Vampire died less than twelve hours ago. No one has had time to get very concerned. Unless Humans First somehow anticipated it happening?  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 17.
How dare you! Mr. Kemp is a highly respected community leader... KEMP. It's alright, Mark, I'm sure Alex didn't mean anything. She's always been very passionate about her causes.

You're using those dead Vampires to spread fear and paranoia. KEMP. If the NYPD is going to continue putting the rights of "Monsters" ahead of Humans, it's up to people like me to ensure the Human majority has a voice.
Even if that voice calls for the slaughter of all non-Humans? KEMP. I didn't get your name, Detective?
Fletcher, Campbell Fletcher. KEMP. A word of advice, Detective Fletcher. A battle is coming, choose your side very carefully.
Campbell drives, Alex, lost in thought, in the passenger seat.
What's the story with you and Kemp?
He was friends with my parents.
But your mother and father were on the front lines of the Non-Human Civil Rights Movement?
And Kemp's one of the planet's biggest bigots? The irony isn't lost on me.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 18.
Your parents' study on Non-Human Integration was one of the primary sources for my Master's thesis. (beat) I'm sorry about what happened to them.
It was a long time ago.
And the police never found their killers? That must be hard. Campbell's compassion prompts Alex to make an unexpected admission.
Yeah. It was... It still is. Alex looks at Campbell's profile for a long moment. Campb turns to see the carefully guarded pain in Alex's eyes. There's a spark of a connection, but Alex breaks it...
Pull over up here. There's someone I need to talk to. As Campbell pulls the car to the curb
Need some back-up?
Good night, Fletcher. Alex exits the car in front of...

Stretching down the block is a red velvet rope holding in check a long line of HOPEFUL ENTRANTS. A CROWD OF YOUNG, CLUBBY TYPES are ignoring the queue, posing for the unimpressed BOUNCER who stands in the doorway. Alex moves confidently toward the club's entrance. She bypasses the line and walks right up to the door. The Bou doesn't speak, but to the chagrin of the posers, he moves aside to let her pass. As she enters, we see a BRASS PLAQ on the door. It reads: CLUB CARNAGE.
Instead of leaving, Campbell watches Alex in his rear vie mirror until he sees Alex go inside the club. Then he pul the car over and parks.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 19.

The décor of the main room is minimalist hipster cool. Se shades of cobalt and purple dominate. Scandinavian design light fixtures cast a warm glow on the patrons. Low slung modern couches are packed with drinkers. Another, larger room has a DJ booth and dance floor filled with dancers. Alex moves purposefully through the crowd to the bar.

Alex sits down on a stool and almost immediately a very d Belvedere vodka martini with two olives is placed before by the beautiful, young, female BARTENDER. Alex acknowledges it with a smile. As she raises her drin to take a sip, a man suddenly appears behind her, whisper in her ear...
Hello, Sasha

(without turning) Hello, Christien. We get our first look at CHRISTIEN as he sits down on the stool next to Alex. He looks so innately dangerous he mus be non-Human, but so devastating attractive, you don't ca A walking advertisement for the seductive pleasures of vampirism,
You look lovely as always.
I'm here on business.
That doesn't make your company any less of a pleasure. Christien reaches out to take Alex's hand. He kisses it with a delicacy that makes Alex unintentionally shiver.
Come to my office. It's quieter. Christen sweeps to his feet and Alex takes a final slug o her drink (for courage?), before following him.

Campbell enters and takes in the scene, looking for Alex. As he makes his way to the bar, the camera pans over to f Jimmy (the Vampire from the Teaser).  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 20. Jimmy prowls the room, looking hungry, a little dangerous He catches the eye of WENDY, a smokin' hot club chick abo his age. Jimmy smiles, he's found his hook-up for the nig
Campbell makes his way to the bar and grabs a seat.
What's your poison?
Beer.
I've never seen you here before.
You remember all your customers?
Just the cute ones.
I'm new in town.

Yum, fresh meat. The Bartender places the beer in front of Campbell and sm while EXTENDING TWO VERY SHARP LONG FANGS. Whoa! That was unexpected. Campbell looks around and now sees interspers with the painted-up human clubbers are Vampires. Ditching his new friend with a somewhat nervous smile, Campbell moves away from the bar and continues his search for Alex.

Christien and Alex enter a room, filled with a mix of bot modern and antique furniture. Its style is both beautiful and timeless, much like Christien. Alex sits on the sumptuous couch as Christien moves to hi personal bar. He pours himself a glass of red wine (or ma it's blood) from a crystal decanter. As he mixes Alex ano martini...
Olives, right?
You know me too well.
I would say, not nearly well enough.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 21. Christien brings Alex her drink and sits down next to her Anxious to change the subject...
I assume you've heard about the tainted blood?
News travels fast in the Vampire community.
That's what I'm afraid of.
The police are worried Vampires will stop going to the banks and start attacking Humans.
Pretty much.
Well, I'm worried that someone is using the blood banks to launch unprovoked attacks against my people.
We're going to find out who's responsible.
Forgive me if I find it hard to believe the police are giving this top priority.

I'm giving it top priority. But I need your help. As leader of the Vampire community in New York, you have the power to keep this contained. We've already shut down two banks and we're running tests at the others. Tell your people not to hunt.
They're scared, they may not listen.
Oh, please. There isn't a Vampire in this City that would dare disobey you.
And in return for my help?  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 22.

Preventing an all out war between Humans and Vampires isn't enough? (beat) Fine. What do you want? Christien just sits, staring at Alex. She wonders what he thinking. She's sure she wouldn't like it. Well, not sure but pretty sure.
I'll have to think about it.
Well, don't take too long. Alex stands to leave.
Christien, until we're sure about the blood... Be careful.
I don't take blood from the banks.
No, I suppose you don't have problems finding consensual donors. Particularly of the female persuasion.
Jealous, Sasha?
Not my scene.
There are fringe benefits. Alex is sure there are. But their conversation is interru when the Bartender runs into the room.
Christien, you better come. There's a fight.
(stunned) A fight? Here?
This I have to see.

Alex and Christien arrive to find shocked club patrons watching as Campbell and one of Christien's BODYGUARDS  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 23. struggle. Or rather Campbell is struggling, the Bodyguard is on top of Campbell, PUMMELING him. Alex's GUN is immediately out, cocked and hovering inches from the Bodyguard's ear
Get off him. The Bodyguard looks toward Christien for guidance. Almost too fast for the Human eye to see, Christien GRABS the Bodyguard and YANKS him way from Campbell.
(to Christien) Thanks. Christien casually TOSSES the Bodyguard aside like an emp candy wrapper.
Good help is so hard to find.
Tell me about it. Campbell bristles at Alex's words and tone.
I thought you might need help.
If I need help, I'll ask for it.
I doubt that.
I won't tolerate this macho-defender crap from you, Fletcher!
And I won't tolerate being treated like some wet-behind-the-ears rookie.
Then stop acting like one. They suddenly fall silent as they realize Christien is intently watching their bickering as someone would follow tennis match.
No please, Sasha, don't stop on my account. This is most entertaining.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 24.
Why is it that every Vampire runs a nightclub? Don't you think it's a little cliché?
Not many establishments remain open all night. Can you see me behind the counter at your local Seven- Eleven? Campbell's not done with Christien, but Alex cuts him off
Thank you for your time, Christien. We don't see him move, but suddenly Christien stands in f of Alex. Looking deep into her eyes...
You are welcome here anytime, Sasha He eyes a steaming Campbell.
But, perhaps you should find a playmate with better manners. Alex quickly ushers Campbell across the room, practically pushing him out an emergency exit door...
Head of Humans First, leader of the Vampire Community, you keep some pretty funky company, Detective.
Are you purposely trying to get yourself killed?
I can take care of myself.
Yeah, I could tell by the way you got the crap beaten out of you.
Who do you think you are?
Back off.
Why? Tell me why and I will.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 25.
(beyond frustrated) Because people who do this job die. And I don't want to be responsible for that!

Who died? Alex takes a deep breath. She can't believe she's even getting into this. But... there's something about the way Campbell is looking at her. Something that suddenly makes her want him to understand.
Mike Wells. We went to the Academy together. We were close. (smiling sadly) He joined the SCD because he believed in what I was trying to do. He joined because he believed in me.
What happened?
We found out someone in the Fairy Court was trafficking illegal weapons. Mike went to meet an informant. Rangers found him two days later. Dead, entombed in a tree in Central Park.
A tree?
The Fairies wanted to send a message.
It's not your fault. He was a cop. He knew the score.

That doesn't make it any easier. For just a moment, there's something in the open, unguard way she's looking at him that threatens to take Campbell' breath away. But then, it's over, leaving Campbell to won if it even happened.
And I won't let it happen again.  NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 26.

Jimmy and Wendy, the beautiful girl we saw him with earli stand in a dark corner of a parking lot down the street f Club Carnage. They're making out against a parked car After a few passionate kisses, Jimmy pulls back.
You know what I want... Wendy pulls her hair back to expose her neck. The white skin almost gleams in the dark.
I'm told I'm very tasty. Jimmy extends his fangs, bites into her jugular. He start to drink. Ecstasy overcomes them both, until...
Okay, that's enough, Jimmy. But, Jimmy can't stop. He's too hungry. He continues to greedily suck at Wendy's neck
I'm serious. You're taking too much! Wendy tries to squirm away, but Jimmy is too strong. We s his EYES FILL WITH BLOOD. Off Wendy as she begins to SCREAM...
NIGHT WATCH - "Pilot" - 3-12-07 27. ACT Two

UNIFORMS survey the crime scene as Alex and Darnell check out Wendy's body with a CRIME SCENE INVESTIGATOR. Wendy's body has a DISTINCT PALE PALLOR. TWO DEEP PUNCTURE MARKS her neck are plainly visible. cSI Judging by rigor and liver temp, I'd put time of death around 4 AM. Cause of death was exsanguination. She was drunk dry.
Get an impression of the puncture wounds. Hopefully our perp's dental molds are on file. Alex and Darnell step aside as the CSI signals for a gurn to take the body away.
It's been months since a Vampire killed a Human like this.
